title: PrivacyG
author: PrivacyG
content: I am very familiar and used to Bisq, Trade Ogre, Local Monero and Agoradesk.  I have been looking for a few weeks at Wizard Swap but am still not entirely sure whether to try it out or not.The main concern of mine is I am using no Java Script and I see this message when I enter their website,QuoteYour browser does not support JavasScript. Some features may not work.I am afraid my trade would not function properly and I may need to re enable Java Script to finish it.  Is there any body who has had experience with their website?  I want to try more Exchanges out of desire to support the few remaining Exchanges who still do not enforce any Know Your Customer policy.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Have you registered or tried to start anything? That might be a good solution to see if you need it (I'm thinking if you get a captcha trying to put a trade through).If it's the .Io site then it looks like you can put in a return address and that should work fine even without Javascript (Javascript is mainly for dynamic styling and autorefresh and a few other things).My issue with it would be the lack of reviews? I can't find many.

comments.author: OrangeFren
comments.body: We've had WizardSwap listed on OrangeFren.com for quite a while now with no major issues. Together with the creator of kycnot.me we even wrote a review of WizardSwap that you can find here: https://forum.orangefren.com/showthread.php?tid=20

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: It says on the main page on the bottom left that no javascript is required:But I just opened Tor browser with no Javascript and I created an order, and I managed to get here:So according to this I guess it's only using JS for auto-refresh.Disclaimer: I am partners with Wizard Swap, so use this info at your own discretion.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: Quote from: PrivacyG on November 29, 2023, 04:12:43 PMI am very familiar and used to Bisq, Trade Ogre, Local Monero and Agoradesk.  I have been looking for a few weeks at Wizard Swap but am still not entirely sure whether to try it out or not.The main concern of mine is I am using no Java Script and I see this message when I enter their website,QuoteYour browser does not support JavasScript. Some features may not work.I am afraid my trade would not function properly and I may need to re enable Java Script to finish it.  Is there any body who has had experience with their website?  I want to try more Exchanges out of desire to support the few remaining Exchanges who still do not enforce any Know Your Customer policy.I have no problem with JS. I visited wizardswap.io with JavaScript enabled. I checked their source code and as I see, one JS is for bootstrap framework, another one is a jQuery framework, another one is also a Popper (UI) JS and the last script is https://www.wizardswap.io/scripts/scripts.js this JS file. You can have a look at it yourself if you want but from my inspection, this script is on the website for basic functionalities like Balance replace, fee replace, rounding numbers and that's all, very simple, basic DOM manipulations.You do not have to worry about visiting this website with JS enabled.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: OrangeFren on September 18, 2024, 01:03:12 PMTogether with the creator of kycnot.me we even wrote a review of WizardSwap that you can find here: https://forum.orangefren.com/showthread.php?tid=20The topic was created about a year ago so I assume some updates have been added since then.Quote from: NotATether on September 18, 2024, 03:04:03 PMSo according to this I guess it's only using JS for auto-refresh.Also the live support chat is gone but you can contact them via email below.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: Synchronice on September 18, 2024, 06:36:36 PMI have no problem with JS. I visited wizardswap.io with JavaScript enabled. I checked their source code and as I see, one JS is for bootstrap framework, another one is a jQuery framework, another one is also a Popper (UI) JS and the last script is https://www.wizardswap.io/scripts/scripts.js this JS file. You can have a look at it yourself if you want but from my inspection, this script is on the website for basic functionalities like Balance replace, fee replace, rounding numbers and that's all, very simple, basic DOM manipulations.You do not have to worry about visiting this website with JS enabled.It's using PHP for the backend and most of the scripts you just mentioned also have CSS for styling.I don't imagine that jQuery is needed to make the exchange. Even calculating the rates is done via an API call.Quote from: hugeblack on September 19, 2024, 06:49:13 AMQuote from: OrangeFren on September 18, 2024, 01:03:12 PMTogether with the creator of kycnot.me we even wrote a review of WizardSwap that you can find here: https://forum.orangefren.com/showthread.php?tid=20The topic was created about a year ago so I assume some updates have been added since then.To be honest, I would be surprised if swap operators changed their website significantly even after long periods of time. I myself haven't noticed any radical changes to the interface since then.
